title: Lok Virsa to hold cultural festival to mark Kashmir Solidarity Day on Feb 5
content:
ISLAMABAD, Feb 3 (APP):The National Institute of Folk and Traditional Heritage (Lok Virsa) will hold a series of programs and activities to mark the forthcoming Kashmir Solidarity falling on 5th February.
The event was being organized in collaboration with Kashmir Affairs and Gilgit-Baltistan Division aimed to highlight the sacrifices of innocent Kashmiri people struggling for their right of self-determination in the Indian Occupied Kashmir through purely a cultural perspective.
According to the details, the event will feature colorful performances based on patriotic and folk song by folk artist and musicians along with Muzakra Screening of documentaries on Kashmir.
Photographic Exhibition will be displayed on Kashmir Exhibition of Books on Kashmir by National Library ofÂ Pakistan.
There will be special exhibition of Kashmiri Artisans-at-work and ,exhibition of Kashmiri Folk Crafts, on Kashmir with Q&A session and display of banners at Lok Virsa premises bearing in favor of Kashmir cause.
